results.title: Asexual reproduction
results.brief_description: Describes asexual reproduction processes and shows how they differ from those of sexual reproduction. Develops three concepts: that all types of asexual reproduction are basically alike, asexually reproduced offspring are like the parents, and there is no fusion of gametes. Illustrates examples of simple fission in microscopic plants and animals and budding in various plants. No other credits available.

results.creator_credit: Michel Darbelly and Swiss National Tourist Office
results.brief_description: Featuring the climbers Michel Darbelly and Michel Vaucher the film reproduces the initial ascent of Petit Clocher by Michel and Daniel Darbelly.

results.title: As time goes by
results.creator_credit: Barry Peak, Chris Kiely and Valhalla
results.brief_description: Science fiction comedy about a bizarre encounter between a knockabout surfer and an alien, set in the Australian outback. The alien enlists the surfer’s aid in finding the power capsule for his spaceship which is disguised as a 1940’s diner. However, there are others with sinister plans in search of the diner and the surfer finds he must change the course of time. Cast includes Bruno Lawrence, Nique Needles, Ray Barrett and Max Gillies.

results.title: As our boyhood is...
results.brief_description: A documentary which studies the facilities for education - both good and bad - available to Afro-American children in the southern states of the USA during the mid-1940’s. An interesting documentary for its time for its sympathetic attitude towards the plight of Afro-American children in getting an education. Photography by Roger Barlow and Jospeh Braun.

results.title: Arts of Japan
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a young American who visits artists of Japan, including the painter Gyokudo Kawai, tea master Soshitsu Sen, actors Koshiro Mataumoto and Manzaburo Umewaka, potter Shoju Hamada, and wood-block artist Shiko Manakata. Includes scenes from the Noh and Kabuki dramas.

results.title: Artist at work: five British sculptors work and talk (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Warren Forma and Forma Arts Associates
results.brief_description: Shows five British sculptors as they work in their studios and discuss their achievements: Barbara Hepworth, who made the centerpiece for the exterior circle of the United Nations Headquarters in New York; Kenneth Armitage, who made “Mouton sun” for Chateau Mouton Rothschild; Lyn Chadwick, who won first prize in 1959 at Padua; Reg Butler, who won grand prize for his monument of the unknown political prisoner in 1953; Henry Moore, who completed the centerpieces for the Lincoln Centre for the Performing Arts in New York.

results.title: Artificial respiration by the H N Method
results.creator_credit: Svend Aage Lorentz and Danish Red Cross
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the method of artificial respiration developed by Holger Nielson. The two basic movements of each cycle are the back pressure and arm lift. Application for adults is demonstrated and the modifications necessary for use on children are also shown.

results.brief_description: Produced for the Royal Agricultural Society of NSW, regarding the attempts to pursue dairy and cattle grazing, and to examine and use artificial insemination as a means of improving stock.

results.title: Article 55
results.creator_credit: Leo Seltzer and Department of Public Information of the United Nations
results.brief_description: Article 55 of the United Nations Charter provides for the promotion of economic and social progress and development. The film shows how a mission to Bolivia was established, and pictures the complete problem which faces them. Shows also how Bolivia suffers with other undeveloped countries the burdens of ill health, of relying on depression prone primary exports, and of lacking the fundamental facilities which attract overseas capital.

results.title: Art survives the times
results.brief_description: A record of art life in France. Leading artists such as Matisse, Picasso, Ultrillo and the sculptors, Roualt, Laurens and Janniot, are shown at work. The architects, Le Corbusier and Perret, also display plans for homes and cities. No other credits available.
